content:
• Friday, April 12, 2013
  • S

    On April 8, Clearwire (CLWR) received an offer from a "strategic buyer" to buy spectrum leases...

    On April 8, Clearwire (CLWR) received an offer from a "strategic buyer" to buy spectrum leases "generally located in large markets that cover approximately 5 billion MHz-POP" for a price of $1B-$1.5B, less the present value of the leases. Clearwire, which made the disclosure in a new 14A, says it will evaluate the offer. The disclosure comes on a day when Bloomberg reports Dish Network, whose $3.30/share offer for Clearwire remains outstanding, approached Deutsche Telekom about possibly merging with T-Mobile USA. CLWR +2.5% AH to $3.34.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 7 Comments

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PLCM +4%. WLK +4%. IM +4%. ANV +4%. RES +4%.
    After-hours top losers: USLV -4%. PTIE -3%. HOLX -3%. ARP -2%. RSH -2%.

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: TAN +14.8%. GAZ +5.1%. REMX +3.9%. EWJ +3.7%. IDV +3.5%.
    ETF Losers: GDXJ -9.1%. VXX -8.7%. GDX -8.1%. PHYS -7.0%. GLD -5.8%.

  • PMC

    PharMerica (NYSE:PMC) names David W. Froesel, Jr. as interim Chief Financial Officer, effective...

    PharMerica (NYSE:PMC) names David W. Froesel, Jr. as interim Chief Financial Officer, effective immediately. Mr. Froesel, who was CFO of Omnicare from 1996 to 2009, and succeeds Michael J. Culotta, who by mutual agreement with the company, has stepped down to pursue other interests. Shares -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ACTG

    Acacia (ACTG +2.7%) has settled several IP suits it has filed against Toshiba; terms are...

    Acacia (ACTG +2.7%) has settled several IP suits it has filed against Toshiba; terms are undisclosed. The settlement comes two days after Acacia announced it had bought 40 CPU and memory-related patents from an unnamed "major technology company," and (in a deal resembling Unwired Planet's arrangement with Ericsson), will share licensing revenue with the company. Look for the patents to be featured in lawsuits shortly.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power (BLDP -5.6%) slides today on a less-than-stellar initiation by Sidoti with a...

    Ballard Power (BLDP -5.6%) slides today on a less-than-stellar initiation by Sidoti with a Neutral rating. The stock has given back most of its gains since nearly doubling last month on number of high profile fuel cell contracts (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.8%) pops in the session's final minutes on a Bloomberg report the...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.8%) pops in the session's final minutes on a Bloomberg report the company is considering paying a special dividend this month.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB -2%) got a great deal on acreage in Texas’ Eagle Ford shale, Jefferies...

    Schlumberger (SLB -2%) got a great deal on acreage in Texas’ Eagle Ford shale, Jefferies calculates, with an implied valuation of ~$3,300/acre vs. more than $20K/acre in recent Eagle Ford deals by other companies. SLB may not make other similar deals, but the Forest Oil (FST -3.5%) agreement is good "advertising" for its "smarter" approach toward unconventional energy sources.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • KNX

    Swift Transportation (SWFT +5.3%) races higher as Deutsche Bank (Buy) raises its price target on...

    Swift Transportation (SWFT +5.3%) races higher as Deutsche Bank (Buy) raises its price target on the shares to $19 from $17. 

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • PNK

    Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK +6.8%) rises on a Deutsche Bank upgrade to Buy and a new price...

    Pinnacle Entertainment (PNK +6.8%) rises on a Deutsche Bank upgrade to Buy and a new price target of $23. The bank cites an underappreciated cash flow profile and "an undemanding valuation in the face of potential multiple expansion scenarios," to justify the notion that PNK has the "best risk-reward" of any regional gaming company. 

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • AT

    Atlantic Power (AT +5.8%) makes the "percentage leaders" list after Macquarie upgrades the...

    Atlantic Power (AT +5.8%) makes the "percentage leaders" list after Macquarie upgrades the shares to Neutral from Underperform. The stock has suffered mightily YTD thanks in no small part to a dividend cut. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • OCN

    Buoyed yesterday by news the HARP program is being extended another two years, the mortgage...

    Buoyed yesterday by news the HARP program is being extended another two years, the mortgage services give it back today after JPMorgan and Wells Fargo report slowdowns in their mortgage business. OCN -3.4%, NSM -2.6%, WAC -3.2%, NCT -1.3%. One would think fewer refis would be a good thing, but they too - especially NSM - make money on originations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNY

    Jones Group (JNY +11.6%) skyrockets after Barington Capital which, according to WSJ, has built a...

    Jones Group (JNY +11.6%) skyrockets after Barington Capital which, according to WSJ, has built a position in the shares over the past 12 months, advises the firm to hire advisers and pursue the disposal of non-core brands. Sales are down $900M since peaking in 2006. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • HMY

    Goldman's short call on gold looks prescient, as comex gold sinks $63.50 to settle at...

    Goldman's short call on gold looks prescient, as comex gold sinks $63.50 to settle at $1,501.40/oz. for its lowest close since July 2011. Traders and analysts see no obvious trigger for the selloff, which seems to reflect the malaise that has gripped the market. Silver slips $1.37 to $26.33/oz. Miners are huge losers: HMY -7.5%, ABX -7.3%, AEM -6.9%, AUY -6.2%, SLW -5.6%, NEM -5.2%, EGO -4.9%, GFI -4.8%, GG -4.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 38 Comments
  • JOY

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -0.9%) fall for a second day in a row on a report by Anonymous...

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY -0.9%) fall for a second day in a row on a report by Anonymous Analytics yesterday that suggested fraud at Joy's IMM unit. William Blair thinks the impact may be overblown, saying that although the report was very detailed and credible, IMM accounts for less than 5% of JOY's earnings. The bigger issue for JOY and other industrial names like CAT are weak mining markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR -2.5%) begins drilling its first operated well in Ohio's Utica...

    Magnum Hunter Resources (MHR -2.5%) begins drilling its first operated well in Ohio's Utica shale, not far from three horizontals drilled by MHR targeting the Marcellus shale to the east. MHR says about half of its 79K-acre net Utica position is in the wet-gas window of the play.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 3 Comments
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.2%) slips today after Credit Suisse lowered its 2013 EPS guidance to $7 from...

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.2%) slips today after Credit Suisse lowered its 2013 EPS guidance to $7 from $7.77, and its price target from $123 to $110. The firm cites declining optimism for an improvement in mining orders, for which it had earlier priced into its forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (HCA -0.7%) takes a breather today after a big run in the previous session, spurred...

    HCA Holdings (HCA -0.7%) takes a breather today after a big run in the previous session, spurred by hedge fund and mutual fund buying as positive sentiment continues drive the hospital sector higher. Analysts see HCA as a proxy for the group, and running up 5% yesterday and leading shares of the rest of the sector higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • AXU

    Alexco Resources (AXU -10.2%) reports Q1 silver production of nearly 380K oz. from its Bellekeno...

    Alexco Resources (AXU -10.2%) reports Q1 silver production of nearly 380K oz. from its Bellekeno mine in Canada's Yukon Territory, lower Y/Y due to sequencing of mining through lower-grade areas resulting in an average silver head grade of 636 grams/metric ton.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • GDX

    Gold miners (GDX -4.5%) are getting destroyed as gold prices cross into bear territory....

    Gold miners (GDX -4.5%) are getting destroyed as gold prices cross into bear territory. Capitulation, if it’s here, would mean a true bottom in price, and Tocqueville Gold Fund's John Hathaway says that's what we’re approaching; he sees strong macro fundamentals for gold, investor sentiment at a negative extreme and compelling valuations in mining shares - "a contrarian's dream scenario."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 18 Comments
  • LH

    Lab Corp. (LH -1.8%) gives back yesterdays gains after being downgraded at WallachBeth Capital...

    Lab Corp. (LH -1.8%) gives back yesterdays gains after being downgraded at WallachBeth Capital to Hold today on valuation. The stock was upgraded yesterday by Goldman, along with Quest Diagnostics (DGX -1.5%), on the sector's improving fundamentals. DGX appears to be giving back a little of the previous session's gain in sympathy as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • HFC

    Oppenheimer points to four reasons that may allow refining stocks to recover from their recent...

    Oppenheimer points to four reasons that may allow refining stocks to recover from their recent selloff: continued wide differentials between WTI and Brent pricing; continued cheap natural gas; growing diesel and gasoline imports; declining environmental spending. But it's another difficult day for sector stocks the firm likes: HFC -1.2%, MPC -3.5%, PSX -2.9%, TSO -1.6%, VLO -2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • NVDA

    The sell-side defends Nvidia (NVDA +2.3%) following yesterday's analyst day remarks, which...

    The sell-side defends Nvidia (NVDA +2.3%) following yesterday's analyst day remarks, which included a promise to ramp buyback activity and a forecast for flat FY14 Tegra sales. Raymond James (Strong Buy) notes Nvidia disclosed its Tegra-specific R&D spend is lower than generally expected, something that now leads it to think the business is turning a profit (previous). Roth (Buy) is cutting its estimates, citing a delay in Tegra 4i's availability, but thinks Nvidia could keep gaining PC GPU share - the GPU improvements accompanying Intel's Haswell CPUs could stand in the way here. (analyst day slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • TEVA

    Generic giant Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA -2%) slides today after CNBC's Jim Cramer recommended...

    Generic giant Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA -2%) slides today after CNBC's Jim Cramer recommended selling the stock earlier, as the company appears to be underperforming its peers. Cramer also warned that the looming patent expiry for its MS treatment Copaxone, which accounts for 20% of TEVA's sales and is set to expire in 2015, makes a ripe target for other generic manufacturers.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN -2%) trades lower on reports that Vascepa's exclusivity status isn't in FDA Orange...

    Amarin (AMRN -2%) trades lower on reports that Vascepa's exclusivity status isn't in FDA Orange Book update for March. Earlier this week the drug was listed in a report by EvaluatePharma called "The industry's brightest hopes: where are they now?" as the fourth most disappointing drug, having seen lofty expectations of a potential $2B annual market dwindle down to just $505M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • OPEN

    PAA Research starts OpenTable (OPEN -1.2%) with a Sell and $30 PT, leading shares to slip. The...

    PAA Research starts OpenTable (OPEN -1.2%) with a Sell and $30 PT, leading shares to slip. The firm thinks OpenTable's conversion rates (for Web traffic?) are declining, and that a false impression of the company as a mobile play has led to an outsized valuation (currently 32x 2013E EPS). Shares remain up 25% YTD. Earlier this week, startup NoWait said it has seated 10M+ diners through a platform that combines an iPad reservation app for restaurants and text message notifications to diners. Unlike OpenTable, NoWait doesn't yet  have an app for diners, but one is planned.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • MPW

    A BofA downgrade sends Medical Properties Trust (MPW -6.9%) tumbling. The bank cuts the shares...

    A BofA downgrade sends Medical Properties Trust (MPW -6.9%) tumbling. The bank cuts the shares to Underperform from Neutral citing the REIT's YTD outperformance relative to the sector overall (it has outpaced healthcare REITs two to one). Put simply, funds from operations "multiple expansion has exceeded fundamental trends." SA contributor Brad Thomas claims MPW is an example of "mispriced risk."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -3.6%) slips after Sidoti cut the shares to Neutral earlier today....

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -3.6%) slips after Sidoti cut the shares to Neutral earlier today. The stock has essentially been dead money since last November, trading in a narrow range between $4 - $5 after cratering off a $23 higher earlier in the year. Just yesterday, Aegis cut its price target on the stock as well. On the surface, that may not seem too significant, but it's worth noting that Aegis has acted as the placement agent for the last four of ROSG-OLD’s public offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM | 1 Comment
  • ELY

    More on Raymond James' Callaway Golf (ELY -6%) downgrade: Given that the company derives around...

    More on Raymond James' Callaway Golf (ELY -6%) downgrade: Given that the company derives around a third of its revenue from Europe and Japan, the "sudden and significant devaluation of the Japanese yen" and concurrent decline in the British pound could present a headwind going forward. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • HIMX

    Himax (HIMX -7.2%) gives back some of this year's huge gains after SA contributor Dividend...

    Himax (HIMX -7.2%) gives back some of this year's huge gains after SA contributor Dividend Monkey offers a short case. Among the author's arguments: there's still no confirmation Himax's LCOS panels are designed into Google Glass (previous), rivals such as Kopin (NASDAQ:KOPN) and Epson have better technology, the display chip market is very cyclical, Himax's EV/EBITDA multiple of 12.5x is well above that of peers, one customer (Chimei Innolux) accounts for 31.8% of revenue, and there are still big questions about just how popular Glass will be.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM

  • A slide in commodity prices turns into a rout: GLD -3.2%, SLV -4.2%, USO -3%, Copper (JJC)...

    A slide in commodity prices turns into a rout: GLD -3.2%, SLV -4.2%, USO -3%, Copper (JJC) -2.2%. At $1,506/oz., gold is threatening a $1,400 handle for the first time in nearly 2 years. After an early bounce, stocks move to session lows, the S&P 500 -0.7%. The long bond gains three-quarters of a full point, its yield down to a 2013 low of 2.93%. Update at 11:05: Now off 4.3%, gold slips below $1,500.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 54 Comments
  • MCD

    Shares of McDonald's (MCD +1.3%) set fresh 52-week highs as the restaurant operator's...

    Shares of McDonald's (MCD +1.3%) set fresh 52-week highs as the restaurant operator's uninspiring streak of flattish global same-store sales doesn't scare off investors. What to watch: The company hasn't disclosed yet if it expects an impact on sales in Asia from the H7N9 avian virus in China so its Q1 earnings report could take on some added significance.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 9 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +4%) moves higher after BofA/ Merrill Lynch upgrades the shares to Buy from...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +4%) moves higher after BofA/ Merrill Lynch upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral. Price target raised to $246 from $187.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • OLED

    Oppenheimer upgrades Universal Display (PANL +3.5%) to Outperform. The firm argues strong...

    Oppenheimer upgrades Universal Display (PANL +3.5%) to Outperform. The firm argues strong smartphone demand will allow the market for small OLED displays to post a 42% CAGR from 2010 to 2015, and that OLED TV growth will contribute to a 70% CAGR over this time for total shipment area. Oppenheimer also likes PANL's operating model, and the "lack of real competition" in the market for phosphorescent OLED materials (used in OLED lighting applications). Needham upgraded PANL last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 4 Comments
  • RAD

    Rite Aid (RAD +6.1%) shoots higher again after recording a tidy post-earning gain yesterday....

    Rite Aid (RAD +6.1%) shoots higher again after recording a tidy post-earning gain yesterday. Today, Raymond James added to the enthusiasm by chiming in with an upgrade to Outperform from Perform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • HD

    Home Depot (HD +1.7%) trades higher early after Jefferies upgrades the shares to Buy from Hold...

    Home Depot (HD +1.7%) trades higher early after Jefferies upgrades the shares to Buy from Hold citing a bullish sales outlook. "Our checks continue to come back favorably," Jefferies says, "weather will not impede" strong Q1 comps. New price target is $85. Competitor Lowe's (LOW +0.5%) is higher by association. (See also: Home garden sales tip in March)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • ELY

    The news from the golf word isn't all from August as shares of Callaway Golf (ELY -6.4%) fall...

    The news from the golf word isn't all from August as shares of Callaway Golf (ELY -6.4%) fall hard after Raymond James downgrades the stock to Market Perform from Strong Buy. The stock has traded in a relatively tight range over the last year while waiting for new growth drivers.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • RALY

    Rally Software (NYSE:RALY) makes good on its name. Shares opened at $17.10 and are currently at...

    Rally Software (NYSE:RALY) makes good on its name. Shares opened at $17.10 and are currently at $17.86, good for an IPO-day gain of 27.6% and a valuation of $403M. (earlier) (S-1)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • IBM

    IBM (IBM -1.1%) and Wipro (WIT -5.7%) join the list of stocks affected by Infosys' (INFY -17.7%)...

    IBM (IBM -1.1%) and Wipro (WIT -5.7%) join the list of stocks affected by Infosys' (INFY -17.7%) revenue miss and light FY14 (ends March '14) guidance. In addition to forecasting soft revenue, the Indian outsourcing giant says it expects its pricing and margins to be pressured over the near-term, though the company's deal pipeline is said to be slightly better than what it was a year ago. Is the weakness simply a result of macro and government budget issues, or are cloud services also taking a toll?

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • MTB

    M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB) and Hudson City Bancorp (NASDAQ:HCBK) both tumble about 4.5% as they...

    M&T Bank (NYSE:MTB) and Hudson City Bancorp (NASDAQ:HCBK) both tumble about 4.5% as they have been unable to gain regulatory approval for their merger. "The timeframe for closing the transaction will be extended substantially beyond the date previously expected." The date for terminating the agreement is moved from August 27 to January 31, 2014. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • CACC

    Credit Acceptance Corporation (NASDAQ:CACC) moves lower before the bell after pricing its 1.5M...

    Credit Acceptance Corporation (NASDAQ:CACC) moves lower before the bell after pricing its 1.5M share secondary offering at $105 per share (~3.5% below yesterday's close). Shares -4% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • FST

    Premarket gainers: FST +12%. IOC +8%. WLT +7%. ASH +5%.Losers: INFY -18%. HIMX -9%. MNKD -8%.

    Premarket gainers: FST +12%. IOC +8%. WLT +7%. ASH +5%.
    Losers: INFY -18%. HIMX -9%. MNKD -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM

  • The gold bear market/correction continues with the metal sliding to $1,537/oz., the lowest since...

    The gold bear market/correction continues with the metal sliding to $1,537/oz., the lowest since last summer. Looking at a longer-term chart, gold has bounced off the low-mid $1,500 level a few times over the last 18 months.  A drop below that would break what the technicians like to call "long-term support." The pattern in silver is similar. GLD -1.6%, SLV -2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 12 Comments
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +6.5% premarket after reporting a strong start to the year thanks to...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) +6.5% premarket after reporting a strong start to the year thanks to higher prices for coal used in steelmaking and rising production. A Brean Capital analyst says that while the performance was not surprising, many investors had feared the worst. Coal names are trading higher: JRCC +4.3%, ANR +2.4%, ACI +1.8%, BTU +1.5%, CLF +1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM | 4 Comments
  • FST

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) +10.9% premarket after it signs an agreement with Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB)...

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) +10.9% premarket after it signs an agreement with Schlumberger (NYSE:SLB) for future development of FST's Eagle Ford Shale acreage in Texas. FST will be the operator of the drilling program; SLB will provide assistance to FST via integrated service offerings and asset management support.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • CHRW

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide (CHRW -0.2%) is downgraded by FBR to Underperform from Outperform as the...

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide (CHRW -0.2%) is downgraded by FBR to Underperform from Outperform as the firm turns skittish on the stock in front of the release of Q1 earnings. CHRW -1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • MNKD

    Shares of Mannkind (NASDAQ:MNKD) trade notably lower before the bell. In an article published...

    Shares of Mannkind (NASDAQ:MNKD) trade notably lower before the bell. In an article published Thursday evening, SA contributor Brian Wilson questions whether the company's key drug Afrezza can pass muster in Phase III clinicals. Shares -6.27% premarket. (The bullish thesis: Afrezza could be first-line therapy)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • CTSH

    Tech outsourcing stocks are on watch after a stark revenue warning from Infosys rattles the...

    Tech outsourcing stocks are on watch after a stark revenue warning from Infosys rattles the sector. Cognizant Technology Solutions (NASDAQ:CTSH) is down 4.8% premarket, while iGATE (NASDAQ:IGTE) and Syntel (NASDAQ:SYNT) haven't opened up yet for trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM

  • Fears about Cyprus, which needs €6B more than the €17B that was originally estimated,...

    Fears about Cyprus, which needs €6B more than the €17B that was originally estimated, are helping cause the slide in European shares and the euro, and possibly U.S. stock futures. Cyprus wants extra help from the eurozone, although the bloc has made it clear that it won't provide any more than the €10B it has already pledged. Cyprus' fate is on the agenda at a Eurogroup meeting in Dublin today. The euro is -0.35% vs the dollar.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:06 AM
  • XNPT

    XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) says its restless leg drug Horizant is sold out, and in this case, that's...

    XenoPort (NASDAQ:XNPT) says its restless leg drug Horizant is sold out, and in this case, that's a bad thing. GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK), which has commercialization rights to the treatment through the end of this month, reports manufacturing delays have led to a stockout of Horizant. XNPT says it is "evaluating the impact, if any, this will have" on financial expectations. Shares -2.48% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • INFY

    Shares of Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) sink 22.9% premarket after the company reports disappointing Q4...

    Shares of Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) sink 22.9% premarket after the company reports disappointing Q4 results and issues soft guidance for FY13. The Indian IT concern sees revenue growing between 6% and 10%, compared to the 12% rate expected by analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 AM

  • Asian and European shares fall as investors take profits after a week of gains and ahead of a...

    Asian and European shares fall as investors take profits after a week of gains and ahead of a meeting of eurozone finance ministers today and tomorrow, when Ireland, Portugal, Cyprus and even Slovenia will or could be on the agenda. Japan -0.5%, Hong Kong -0.1%, China -0.6%, India -1.6%. EU Stoxx 50 -0.9%, London -0.5%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt -0.8%, Italy -1.1% and Madrid -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 AM
  • TI

    Hutchison Whampoa would want to control any company created by merging its 3 Italia mobile unit...

    Hutchison Whampoa would want to control any company created by merging its 3 Italia mobile unit with Telecom Italia's (NYSE:TI) cellular operations. Hutchison would become TI's largest shareholder as part of the deal, possible causing the unravelling of the Telco consortium that holds 22.4% in the former monopoly. Telco includes Telefonica (NYSE:TEF), Intesa Sanpaolo (OTCPK:IITOF) and Mediobanca (OTC:MDIBF). TI is also looking at spinning off its wireline operations. Shares +4.3% in Milan.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 AM
  • INFY

    Infosys Ltd ADR (NASDAQ:INFY): Q4 EPS of Rs.23.94B beats by Rs.970M. Revenue of Rs.104.54B (+18%...

    Infosys Ltd ADR (NASDAQ:INFY): Q4 EPS of Rs.23.94B beats by Rs.970M. Revenue of Rs.104.54B (+18% Y/Y) misses by Rs.276M. Shares -18% in India.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 AM
